Fun and relaxing. Some game control issues but I'm sure they'll be worked out by the next game! Give this a try if you enjoy relaxing games.

So we pay for the game but it ends so quickly? when is part 2 coming out and will we have to pay for it too? Sorry but that amount is no worth the tiny little game. Ive payed the same amount for full games just as good.

Great game! The graphics are spot on, the only reason only 4 stars is I wish the game was a bit longer, but overall keep up the great work. I really like the hint feature. When I felt stuck or that I was missing something it did great!

The graphics and concept is great, but the controls are way too touchy like holding the screen to see what things have actions but instead he walks there, and the items list disappears too quickly when trying to join items together. It's also hard to tell what item is what, it should have a text of what they are when selected. Game was too short for the price.
Cannot progress in the game because the bit of hanging spiderweb won't appear. Without that I cannot finish making my bow. Game is faulty.
replyContent: There is NOTHING wrong with the game. You are watching walkthrough of an old version. In the new version sider web will appear LATER. Just follow the game and use hints if you are stuck. There is nothing wrong with spider web. Please check and change your score. If you have any questions please contact us: play@loopymood.com

content: I want to give this beautiful game 5 stars so bad, but you have GOT to lay off the hints. What's the point of a point and click adventure game if you hold our hands and guide us all the way. Or at least make diffrent difficulties, where you can disable hints. Edited to 5 ‚òÜ for the reply, Absolutely beautiful game, keep up the good work and try to figure out away to turn off the hints.
replyContent:
Hi. It's nice to hear from a real Point and Click adventure fan. Sorry for your play experience. Actually we introduced hint system in our latest update, since a lot of players were asking for more guidance and were feeling lost at some places. 
We will think what we can do. But anyway, thanks for playing.

content: A quick dose of ambitious fun! This is great for a 1 or 2 hours chill on a weekend! :) I like how the story progresses and goals change as our little ant adapts to the changes in his surroundings. The puzzles are easily doable and if you're stuck for some reason, the hints offer a clear solution. The graphics are adorable with a mix of drawing, animation and real world pics. Although there is sometimes a bug where the ant doesn't run and just slowly walks, it doesn't ruin the experience.
replyContent: Thank you for your detailed review!

It is just too tedious and completely obscure

content: some constructive critisism for the next one: Access to acquired items is tedious; especially since the item tray closes itself after every attempted use of item and some (most) interactions require trial and error of several items. Otherwise beautiful and clever.

content: Game is cute. I enjoy the macro design and the protagonist is comical and has a lot of character to him. I found myself having to use the clue button frequently to keep the pace. The gameplay from the start allowed you to pick up pieces that have nothing to do with immediate progression, so you just keep trying to combine them with things. Some items seem absurd but work. You also need to interact with the environment at times. These elements combined make for a confusing and frustrating exp.
replyContent: Thank you for a review!

content: A wonderfully amazing adventure. I've played through tiny bits of this game as an alternative to story time with my four year old. In over a dozen cosy evenings we have completed the game. I didn't find it that short after all. The pecking crow was absolutely terrifying to my son but the farts he found - of course - hilarious. The ending had him laughing even louder. We really connected with the protantgonist of the game and look eagerly forward to the sequel! Cheers, T&R
replyContent: Thank you for playing AntVentor!
